description: Grade 3 endometrioid adenocarcinoma of the endometrium measuring 5.0 x 2.7 cm with 0.7 cm myometrial invasion (FIGO IA), no cervical or nodal involvement, and focal lymphovascular space invasion, margins negative.
patient_notes: Your report shows an early-stage uterine cancer confined to the inner layer of the uterus without spread to lymph nodes or surrounding structures. The tumor was completely removed with surgery, and all surgical margins are clear. Because this is a higher-grade tumor, we recommend targeted vaginal radiation (brachytherapy) to lower the chance of recurrence. This treatment focuses on the upper part of the vagina and helps protect healthy tissues.

verification.assessment: FIGO IA (myometrial invasion <50%) and pT1a N0 staging are accurate and consistent. Grade 3 disease with focal LVSI supports vaginal brachytherapy per NCCN guidelines for stage IA endometrioid adenocarcinoma.
